GlobalGoodsType.title: Software
GlobalGoodsType.description: A free and open-source software tool designed to manage, analyze, or transmit health-related data, with proven utility in multiple settings.

License.name: Mozilla Public License 2.0

SDGs.description: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages

HealthStandards.description: International standards for transfer of clinical and administrative data between software applications

HealthStandards.description: Universal standard for identifying medical laboratory observations

Interoperability.name: Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources
Interoperability.description: A standard describing data formats and elements and an application programming interface for exchanging electronic health records

Interoperability.name: HL7 V2
Interoperability.description: Health Level 7 Version 2, a messaging standard for exchanging clinical and administrative data in healthcare settings.

Interoperability.name: HL7 V3
Interoperability.description: Health Level 7 Version 3, an XML-based messaging framework for health data exchange and interoperability.

ProductOverview.Summary: The OpenELIS Global software is an enterprise-level laboratory information system built on open-source web-based technologies that has been tailored for low-and-middle income country public health laboratories.
ProductOverview.Description: OpenELIS offers functionality suitable for supporting jobs and workflows of laboratory technicians, laboratory managers, and public health epidemiologists. Laboratory technicians can use the system to capture data on laboratory orders, tests, and results. Laboratory managers can use the system to track laboratory quality assurance processes. Public health epidemiologists can use OpenELIS data in a central data repository for disease surveillance. The system is suitable for use in any clinical lab, but it is specifically designed for public health labs in limited resource setting
ProductOverview.Users: laboratory technicians, laboratory managers, and public health epidemiologists.

Reach.SummaryOfReach: OpenELIS is implemented nationally in Cote d’Ivoire, Mauritius, and Haiti. It has implementations in at least 192 labs, with many more using the 1.x version bundled in Bahmni Hospital Operating System.

en.formal: the Socialist Republic of Viet Nam

Maturity.SummaryOfMaturity: All maturity model assessments are self-reported by the funded organization leading the development of the global good.  The scores for Inclusive Design, Climate Resilience and Low Carbon are not available as this assessment was done using the previous version of the maturity model.

Sustainability.Description: OpenELIS is supported through a mix of grants, implementation funding, and core funding

collectionInitiative.label: Digital Public Goods Alliance
collectionInitiative.description: A multi-stakeholder initiative to accelerate the attainment of the Sustainable Development Goals in low- and middle-income countries by facilitating the discovery, development, use of, and investment in digital public goods.

collectionInitiative.label: DIAL Exchange
collectionInitiative.description: A platform by the Digital Impact Alliance to connect digital public goods and solutions for global development.
